data.name: IRR Calculation - evaluation of profitability
data.description:
IRR, or Internal rate of return, is a common indicator for the profitability based on the discounted future cash flow

For example, you invest 100 bucks now and you have out-flow of cash. In economic terms it can be represented as c0 = -100 at t0. At the end of year, you expect a return of 110 at t1, that is c1 = 110. So the discount rate r (or interest rate in the same sense) makes you break-even is IRR

c0/(1+r)^0 + c1/(1+r)^1 = 0

in this case, r = 0.1

Generally, IRR can be expressed as follows

c0/(1+r)^0 + c1/(1+r)^1 + .. + cn/(1+r)^n= 0

For more information, you can refer to Wiki

Task

  • implement function irr which takes an array of cash flow [c0, c1, c2, ...]as parameter and returns the IRR
  • your result should be at least with a precision of 0.000001
  • if the cash flows are 0 through out the periods, return 0
  • you should take all other extreme cases into account.
  • effeciency matters! please make sure that your loop ends in no more than 40 step
  • good luck!
